rComments: Jack Schaar was not easy, but he's the best Professor I ever had. Throw what you think you know about politics--and school--out the window. Two assignments: each with a topic and length of your own choosing. Some don't like lack of structure, but for self-starters the freedom is great. Don't think you can skate by though, Schaar will challenge you!

Not only theoretically brilliant Jack Schaar is engaging and poetic. His lectures were beautifully crafted, some I attended received ovations!Jack Schaar is truly an original thinker and will cause you to think and to defend your positions with something more than PC cant.I found him to be accessible, likable and generous
Deep thinker, the best lecturer at Santa Cruz (I recorded them for two years!).  If you're a thinker (10% of college population) then he is THE MAN!  Most inspiring professor I ever had.

He's an amazing wealth of knowledge that naturally challenges you in the content and the way it's taught. Very comprehensive class. You won't be bored with him, and he just might put you on the spot. A whole nother league of professor!! His cridentials are out of this world, too ...

Jack Schaar was one of the most inspiring teachers I have ever heard lecture.  I wasn't in the inner circle, so I didn't get a lot of help or attention.  But he talked about things that made me wonder and helped me grow!

I agree Jack is probably one of the most intelligent professors on Campus. I'm not too sure why everyone thinks the course load was so heavy, in each of his classes he asks you to write a midterm paper and a final paper. Thats it! You choose the topic, and the length.  It is true his classes demand you to think!

best prof I've ever had, hands down. going to his classes made college worthwhile. absolutely brilliant, and uniquely candid. words fail me... not nec. an easy class, but if you really wanna learn something, this is the guy. seriously, he might be the most intelligent man I've ever met. despite complaints about availabilit, he's very aproachable.

Not for the faint of heart - this guy practically reinvented his field. I probably learned more from him than from any other instructor at UCSC.  Ask an honest, intelligent question and he'll answer in kind.  If you're just looking to fufill a requirement, look elsewhere.  If you actually want to learn and think, sign on up.

Class structure was very vague and unclear.  He was hard to get in touch with and while he had some interesting points the material didn't seem to come together.  Wouldn't recommend taking any of his classes.
Not one for the slackers. Brilliant and engaging.

Three words: Conservative Christian Anarchist. Only he can explain it. When I went to UCSC, I struggled in his class, but it inspired me to go into politics. Also, he chain smokes and drinks at 8 AM. Can't be all bad

Did not hold office hours, only discussed before or after class. Vague essay assignments. Not helpful in essay writing.  Great Lecturer.  VERY DIFFICULT GRADER--writes demeaning, insulting evaluations if he does not like your thinking. Do not take unless for p/np credit.

Interesting class. Very insightful teacher. BE WARNED: he believes in "old school" grading where "A"s are only given to one, maybe two students per class. I worked my ass off, had good attendance, participated, wrote great papers and got a "B-".

Sure he's old and somewhat long winded. But let's face it. He's ****ing brilliant. He's a living legend in the political theory world and well worth your time. He does have office hours. He was made when professors cared about teaching.

Jack Schaar - they bring this guy back from retirement when they run short of lecturers.  No email, no phone, no pffice hours.  Impossible to meet, ridiculous reading requirements, and a total dependence on TAs.  Horrible, unless you love the Puritans.
